ch.cern.dod.db.entity

Class DODInstance

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.cern.dod.db.entity.DODInstance
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable

    public class DODInstance
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Represents a database in the system.
    Author:
    Daniel Gomez Blanco

    • Field Detail

      • username

        private java.lang.String username
        Username creator of this instance (max. 32)

      • dbName

        private java.lang.String dbName
        DB name for this instance (max. 8) The DB name limitation comes from the fact that Oracle SID's can only be 8 characters

      • eGroup

        private java.lang.String eGroup
        DB e-Group (max. 256)

      • category

        private java.lang.String category
        Category of the instances (personal, test or official, max. 32)

        Creation date

        Database size (in GB)

      • noConnections

        private int noConnections
        Number of connections

      • project

        private java.lang.String project
        Project

      • description

        private java.lang.String description
        Database description (max. 1024)

      • version

        private java.lang.String version
        Version of the database (max. 128)

      • upgradeTo

        private java.lang.String upgradeTo
        Upgrade available for the database (calculated field)

      • status

        private boolean status
        Logical status (active or inactive)

      • master

        private java.lang.String master
        DB name of the master (if slave)

      • slave

        private java.lang.String slave
        DB name of the slave (if master)

      • host

        private java.lang.String host
        Host where instance is running

      • state

        private java.lang.String state
        State (On Creation, Running, Stopped, etc)

      • checked

        private boolean checked
        If an instance is checked or not in the overview page for admins. If it is checked it will be counted for collective actions.
